00031 const unsigned int BT_MAX_THREAD_COUNT = 64;  // only if BT_THREADSAFE is 1

00045 class btSpinMutex
00046 {
00047     int mLock;
00048 
00049 public:
00050     btSpinMutex()
00051     {
00052         mLock = 0;
00053     }
00054     void lock();
00055     void unlock();
00056     bool tryLock();
00057 };
00058 
00059 
00060 //
00061 // NOTE: btMutex* is for internal Bullet use only
00062 //
00063 // If BT_THREADSAFE is undefined or 0, should optimize away to nothing.
00064 // This is good because for the single-threaded build of Bullet, any calls
00065 // to these functions will be optimized out.
00066 //
00067 // However, for users of the multi-threaded build of Bullet this is kind
00068 // of bad because if you call any of these functions from external code
00069 // (where BT_THREADSAFE is undefined) you will get unexpected race conditions.
00070 //
00071 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void btMutexLock( btSpinMutex* mutex )
00072 {
00073 #if BT_THREADSAFE
00074     mutex->lock();
00075 #endif // #if BT_THREADSAFE
00076 }
00077 
00078 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void btMutexUnlock( btSpinMutex* mutex )
00079 {
00080 #if BT_THREADSAFE
00081     mutex->unlock();
00082 #endif // #if BT_THREADSAFE
00083 }
00084 
00085 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool btMutexTryLock( btSpinMutex* mutex )
00086 {
00087 #if BT_THREADSAFE
00088     return mutex->tryLock();
00089 #else
00090     return true;
00091 #endif // #if BT_THREADSAFE
00092 }
00093 
00094 
00095 //
00096 // btIParallelForBody -- subclass this to express work that can be done in parallel
00097 //
00098 class btIParallelForBody
00099 {
00100 public:
00101     virtual ~btIParallelForBody() {}
00102     virtual void forLoop( int iBegin, int iEnd ) const = 0;
00103 };
00104 
00105 //
00106 // btITaskScheduler -- subclass this to implement a task scheduler that can dispatch work to
00107 //                     worker threads
00108 //
00109 class btITaskScheduler
00110 {
00111 public:
00112     btITaskScheduler( const char* name );
00113     virtual ~btITaskScheduler() {}
00114     const char* getName() const { return m_name; }
00115 
00116     virtual int getMaxNumThreads() const = 0;
00117     virtual int getNumThreads() const = 0;
00118     virtual void setNumThreads( int numThreads ) = 0;
00119     virtual void parallelFor( int iBegin, int iEnd, int grainSize, const btIParallelForBody& body ) = 0;
00120 
00121     // internal use only
00122     virtual void activate();
00123     virtual void deactivate();
00124 
00125 protected:
00126     const char* m_name;
00127     unsigned int m_savedThreadCounter;
00128     bool m_isActive;
00129 };
00130 
00131 // set the task scheduler to use for all calls to btParallelFor()
00132 // NOTE: you must set this prior to using any of the multi-threaded "Mt" classes
00133 void btSetTaskScheduler( btITaskScheduler* ts );
00134 
00135 // get the current task scheduler
00136 btITaskScheduler* btGetTaskScheduler();
00137 
00138 // get non-threaded task scheduler (always available)
00139 btITaskScheduler* btGetSequentialTaskScheduler();
00140 
00141 // get OpenMP task scheduler (if available, otherwise returns null)
00142 btITaskScheduler* btGetOpenMPTaskScheduler();
00143 
00144 // get Intel TBB task scheduler (if available, otherwise returns null)
00145 btITaskScheduler* btGetTBBTaskScheduler();
00146 
00147 // get PPL task scheduler (if available, otherwise returns null)
00148 btITaskScheduler* btGetPPLTaskScheduler();
00149 
00150 // btParallelFor -- call this to dispatch work like a for-loop
00151 //                 (iterations may be done out of order, so no dependencies are allowed)
00152 void btParallelFor( int iBegin, int iEnd, int grainSize, const btIParallelForBody& body );
00153

00155 #endif
